beer.beer_description: Collaboration No. 3 with Heyday Beer Co from Wellington brings us a winter warmer of ultra-traditional heritage. Brewed on the winter solstice of 2024 this is a rich and malt forward Pale Ale for sipping on dark winter evenings. A traditional French farmhouse style usually brewed in winter and bottle-aged until the following winter or even longer for full maturation and enjoyment. Our version is dark copper in colour and incorporates three different rye malts giving a spicy dry feel to this beautiful style. Drink now or keep for up to 3 years.

items.badge_description: Kiwis, rugby and sheep aren’t the only things New Zealand has to offer. There’s a ton of great beers in a variety of styles just waiting for you to explore! That's 45 different beers from a brewery in New Zealand. Try 5 more for Level 10.

Our version is dark copper in colour and incorporates three different rye malts giving a spicy dry feel to this beautiful style. Drink now or keep for up to 3 years.

items.badge_description: Your quest to quench your thirst leaves no stone unturned! That's at least 135 distinct venues!
Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 60 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 13!

items.badge_description: Traditionally brewed in the Nord-Pas-de-Calais region of France, Bière de Garde is a style meant to be aged, so don’t rush it! That's 10 different beers with the style of Bière de Garde or Bière de Mars. Try 5 more for Level 3!

Our version is dark copper in colour and incorporates three different rye malts giving a spicy dry feel to this beautiful style. Drink now or keep for up to 3 years.

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 260 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%.  Try 5 more for Level 53!

It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That's 350 check-ins with a photo.  Try 5 more for Level 71!

items.badge_description: What happens when you take two or more amazing breweries, throw them into the tank and let them ferment together? An amazing collaboration beer, that’s what! Cheers to working together to create the perfect flavor. That's 95 different beers that have been brewed as a collaboration. Try 5 more for Level 20!

You have a keen taste for this Belgian masterpiece. Did you know the Saison style beer was invented by Belgian farms, brewed in the Winter and served the Spring/Summer to all their workers? Well now you do! That’s 40 different Farmhouse Ales! Try 5 more for Level 9.

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 280 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 57!
